Did you know Brad Pitt‚Äôs Formula 1 movie almost filmed *at* Daytona International Speedway? It sounds perfect, right? But the team was actually told ‚Äòno‚Äô.
Here‚Äôs what happened. The movie's opening scene needed to depict a crucial race, but Daytona‚Äôs track is significantly different from a Formula 1 circuit. It‚Äôs wider and has different banking.
To maintain authenticity ‚Äì to make the racing look *real* ‚Äì filming at Daytona would have meant massive visual effects to alter the track digitally. That‚Äôs expensive and could have looked fake.
So, they filmed at the Circuit of the Americas in Austin, Texas. It‚Äôs a proper F1 track, meaning less digital trickery and a more believable race for viewers.
What it means is, even a blockbuster movie prioritizes detail when it comes to getting things right for dedicated fans. It‚Äôs all about the experience!
